meanings.definition: To discharge a weapon or missile at a target.
meanings.sent1: He will shoot the arrow at the target.
meanings.sent2: The police officer had to shoot the suspect to protect others.
meanings.sent3: The cowboy decided to shoot at the cans for target practice.
meanings.sent4: Her words shot through his heart like an arrow.
meanings.sent5: The basketball player's shot was perfect, just like a skilled archer.

meanings.sent1: The seeds will shoot up from the ground in spring.
meanings.sent2: The plant will shoot new leaves after the rain.
meanings.sent3: The flowers seemed to shoot out of the soil overnight.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity shot up like a sudden burst of sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The tree's branches shot upwards towards the sky, reaching for the sun.

meanings.sent1: The tiny shoot on the tree was a sign of new life.
meanings.sent2: She carefully trimmed the new shoot on the rose bush.
meanings.sent3: The little shoot swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The shoot looked like a miniature version of the larger branch.
meanings.sent5: The green shoot stood out among the older branches, vibrant and fresh.
